newsitem.title: SPAIN: Popular shares sink after H1 results disappoint.
newsitem.headline: Popular shares sink after H1 results disappoint.

text.p: Shares in Banco Popular undercut Spain's stock indices on Tuesday after first half results disappointed expectations, dealers and analysts said.
At 1010 GMT Popular was down 800 pesetas, 2.11 percent, to 37,200 while the Ibex-35 blue chip index was down 0.81 percent to 7,111.04.
Popular said first half attributable profit rose 4.2 percent to 31.41 billion pesetas from 30.13 billion pesetas.
Analysts focused on net interest income, which fell 2.9 percent to 86.75 billion pesetas, and customer loans, which grew 5.6 percent from end-1996 and 10.9 percent year-on-year.

"These results were below expectations...Financial charges have not decreased as quickly as we were expecting, and this has impacted the whole profit and loss account," said Javier Bernat, analyst at Inverban brokerage.
"While (key money) rates continue to fall or stabilise, it seems their net interest income isn't going to be one of the best," he said.
Expectations that a pick-up on the consumer side of the economy would be translated into increased demand for loans seemed to be taking time filtering through.
"What surprised us were customer loans, as they should be seeing better growth. Obviously it makes you more pessimistic," he said, adding that Inverban would likely revise down its target price.
"In Popular everyone expected better results. The problem is in net interest income. Everyone said buy Popular because it would improve on consumer spending," one analyst said.
"But lower interest rates seem to be affecting them a lot, with narrow margins," she added.
